channel.title: What ip do I use to run a server? PLEASE HELP!
channel.description: Do I use the ip on my computer which is 192.168.2.46 Or The ip i see when i type My ip on google: 184.14*.73.8* *are for protection. When i use the 184.14*.73.8* one i cant load the server, not can anyone else, the client just stays at 0% :( Help please!!

item.title: What ip do I use to run a server? PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @IHitSpecs IHitSpecs
item.description:
@IHitSpecs wrote:

Dr Jig:

As i said sign up for a no-ip address. Have you set your variables?

I Have signed up, i had No-Ip DUC running with my server ip check marked, and it was running, and how would i do that? Im pretty sure i did.

Read full topic

item.title: What ip do I use to run a server? PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @IHitSpecs IHitSpecs
item.description:
@IHitSpecs wrote:

No obviously not, i want it online, so my friends can connect, i have portforwarded and all that but the whenever i type the ip that i see when i google my ip, i get error_connect or whatever, Im 99.9% sure i have it port forwarded correctly, PLease help! BUMP!

if u are its 127.0.0.1

item.source: What ip do I use to run a server? PLEASE HELP!

item.title: What ip do I use to run a server? PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Dr_Jig Dr Jig
item.description:
@Dr_Jig wrote:

Hi have you portforwarded your router ip??? and u could try making a no-ip then downloading their programe “duc” and have duc running constantly if u make a no-ip it shouuuuuld work.i am currently hosting my rsps on a vps and im using both no-ip and the vps ip. for example 94.23.535.533 (example only not actual) very hard to explain but that only works on a vps.

U can use ur router ip, but in your case i think you should sign up for a no-ip

Read full topic
